gr.forth.ics.swkm.model2.labels
Interface Hierarchy

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractHierarchy, MainMemoryHierarchy
public interface Hierarchy

Author:
Andreou Dimitris, email: jim.andreou (at) gmail (dot) com

Method Summary
 Collection<Node> exploreAncestors(Node node)
          Explores and returns all the ancestors (direct or indirect) of the specified node.
 Collection<Node> exploreDescendants(Node node)
          Explores and returns all the descendants (direct or indirect) of the specified node.
 InspectableGraph exploredGraph()
          Returns the currently explored graph, including the root.
 Collection<Node> exploreDirectAncestors(Node node)
          Explores and returns all the direct ancestors of the specified node.
 Collection<Node> exploreDirectDescendants(Node node)
          Explores and returns all the direct descendants of the specified node.
 void exploreEverythingAsNew()
          Explores everything from the database.
 Collection<Node> exploreNodesIncludedIn(Collection<Interval> ranges)
          Explores and returns all nodes of which the tree label is included in at least one of the provided ranges.
 Label getExistingLabelOf(Node node)
          Returns a copy of the existing label of a node, or null if the node is new.
 int getIndexForNewHierarchy()
          Returns the next free index of the label of the root of this hierarchy.
 Label getLabelOf(Node node)
          Returns the most-recent label of the specified node, or an empty label if there is none.
 Collection<Node> getNewRoots()
          Returns the new nodes which have none new direct ancestors.
 Node getRoot()
          Returns the root of this hierarchy.
 boolean hasUpdatedLabel(Node node)
          Returns whether a node has different existing label (getExistingLabelOf(Node)) and current label (getLabelOf(Node)).
 boolean isNew(Node node)
          Tests whether the specified node is new, i.e. it does not have an existing label.
 void propagateInterval(Node node, Interval interval)
          Propagates an interval to a node and to all its ancestors.
 void recalculateIndexForNewHierarchy()
          Recalculates the next free index of the label of the root of this hierarchy.
 

Method Detail

getRoot

Node getRoot()
Returns the root of this hierarchy. It is guaranteed to always have an existing label.

exploredGraph

InspectableGraph exploredGraph()
Returns the currently explored graph, including the root.

exploreDirectAncestors

Collection<Node> exploreDirectAncestors(Node node)
Explores and returns all the direct ancestors of the specified node. The node must currently belong to the explored part of this hierarchy (see exploredGraph()).

exploreAncestors

Collection<Node> exploreAncestors(Node node)
Explores and returns all the ancestors (direct or indirect) of the specified node. The node must currently belong to the explored part of this hierarchy (see exploredGraph()).

exploreDirectDescendants

Collection<Node> exploreDirectDescendants(Node node)
Explores and returns all the direct descendants of the specified node. The node must currently belong to the explored part of this hierarchy (see exploredGraph()).

exploreDescendants

Collection<Node> exploreDescendants(Node node)
Explores and returns all the descendants (direct or indirect) of the specified node. The node must currently belong to the explored part of this hierarchy (see exploredGraph()).

exploreNodesIncludedIn

Collection<Node> exploreNodesIncludedIn(Collection<Interval> ranges)
Explores and returns all nodes of which the tree label is included in at least one of the provided ranges.

isNew

boolean isNew(Node node)
Tests whether the specified node is new, i.e. it does not have an existing label.

getNewRoots

Collection<Node> getNewRoots()
Returns the new nodes which have none new direct ancestors. These are always explored.

getExistingLabelOf

Label getExistingLabelOf(Node node)
Returns a copy of the existing label of a node, or null if the node is new. The specified node must be explored.

getLabelOf

Label getLabelOf(Node node)
Returns the most-recent label of the specified node, or an empty label if there is none. The returned label can be modified to actually change the label of the node. The specified node must be explored.

hasUpdatedLabel

boolean hasUpdatedLabel(Node node)
Returns whether a node has different existing label (getExistingLabelOf(Node)) and current label (getLabelOf(Node)). The specified node must be explored.

getIndexForNewHierarchy

int getIndexForNewHierarchy()
Returns the next free index of the label of the root of this hierarchy. This could be also calculated by exploring the direct descendants of the root and subtracting their labels from the root label. This method is not guaranteed to explore the direct descendants of the root.

recalculateIndexForNewHierarchy

void recalculateIndexForNewHierarchy()
Recalculates the next free index of the label of the root of this hierarchy.

See Also:
getIndexForNewHierarchy()

propagateInterval

void propagateInterval(Node node,
                       Interval interval)
Propagates an interval to a node and to all its ancestors.

exploreEverythingAsNew

void exploreEverythingAsNew()
Explores everything from the database.
